payload.title: I wnat to build a notion like view of docs that uses obsidia...

message.content:
I wnat to build a notion like view of docs that uses obsidian sync rust crate to log into obsidian, view the vault contents and show them in a nice viewer. Much like perlite - but the files will be stored in a sqlite instead of on the filesystem. 

don't worry too much about the sync spec. let's use a mock stub. instead let's focus on the front end. 

it shoudl take advantage of the obsidian markdown, and then take advantage of how pretty notion is. 

graph mode, linking, etc

I can see you want to build a Notion-like viewer for Obsidian vaults! This is an interesting project combining the best of both worlds - Obsidian's markdown features with Notion's beautiful UI. Let me structure this spec properly and create some initial idea cards to capture the key components.

payload.title: Notion-Style Obsidian Vault Viewer
payload.one_liner: A beautiful Notion-inspired frontend viewer for Obsidian markdown vaults stored in SQLite
payload.goal: Create an elegant web viewer that combines Obsidian's markdown capabilities with Notion's polished UI design, focusing on the frontend experience
payload.description: Build a viewer application that displays Obsidian vault contents with a Notion-like interface. The app will use obsidian sync rust crate (via mock stub) to access vault data, store documents in SQLite instead of the filesystem (similar to Perlite), and provide a rich frontend experience. Key features include support for Obsidian markdown syntax, wiki-style linking, graph view for visualizing connections between notes, and a clean, modern UI inspired by Notion's design philosophy.
payload.constraints: Use mock stub for Obsidian sync functionality (not focusing on sync spec initially). Documents must be stored in SQLite database rather than filesystem. Frontend-focused development.
payload.notes: Reference: Perlite as a similar project. Frontend is the primary focus.

card.title: Notion-inspired UI Design
card.body: Design and implement a clean, modern frontend inspired by Notion's aesthetic. Should include smooth animations, elegant typography, proper spacing, and an intuitive navigation experience.

card.title: Obsidian Markdown Rendering
card.body: Support full Obsidian markdown syntax including wiki-links [[like this]], backlinks, tags, embedded images, code blocks with syntax highlighting, callouts/admonitions, and other Obsidian-specific markdown extensions.

card.title: SQLite Storage Backend
card.body: Implement SQLite database to store vault documents instead of reading from filesystem. Schema should support document content, metadata, links between documents, and efficient querying for the graph view.

card.title: Interactive Graph View
card.body: Implement a graph visualization mode showing connections between notes through wiki-links and backlinks. Should be interactive, allowing users to navigate between notes by clicking nodes, zoom/pan, and filter by tags or other criteria.

card.title: Wiki-style Linking System
card.body: Support bidirectional linking between documents. When a note links to another, both should be aware of the connection. Display backlinks prominently in the UI like both Obsidian and Notion do.

card.title: Mock Obsidian Sync Stub
card.body: Create a mock implementation of the obsidian sync rust crate integration for initial development. This allows frontend work to proceed without worrying about the actual sync implementation details.

card.title: Frontend-First Approach
card.body: Development should prioritize the frontend experience. Sync functionality should use mock stubs to avoid blocking frontend progress.

message.content: I've structured your spec with a clear goal and created 7 cards covering the main components: UI design, markdown rendering, SQLite storage, graph view, linking system, the mock sync stub, and a constraint about the frontend-first approach. Now I'd like to clarify some important details about your vision.

question.question: What's your primary use case for this viewer? This will help prioritize features.
choices: Personal knowledge management (reading/browsing my own notes)
Sharing published vaults with others (read-only public access)
Just exploring/learning (experimenting with the tech stack)

payload.diff_summary: Structured the spec with title, one-liner, goal, description, and constraints. Created 7 initial cards covering UI design, markdown rendering, SQLite storage, graph view, linking system, mock sync stub, and frontend-first constraint. Asked clarifying question about primary use case.

message.content: Great! The manager has laid a solid foundation with 7 cards covering the core components. Now I'll brainstorm additional creative ideas to expand the feature set. I'm thinking about UI/UX enhancements, specific Notion-inspired features, Obsidian-specific capabilities, and technical implementation details that could make this viewer truly shine. Let me generate some fresh ideas!

card.title: Slash Command Menu
card.body: Implement Notion's signature '/' command menu for quick actions. Users can type '/' to insert blocks, change formatting, add embeds, create tables, etc. This makes the interface feel modern and efficient.

card.title: Block-Based Content Structure
card.body: Adopt Notion's block-based approach where every paragraph, heading, list item, etc. is a distinct draggable block. Users can reorder content by dragging blocks, making organization intuitive and visual.

card.title: Tag Browser and Filter System
card.body: Create a dedicated tag browser view showing all tags used across the vault. Allow filtering notes by single or multiple tags, with visual indicators showing tag frequency and relationships between tagged notes.

card.title: Embedded Note Previews
card.body: Support Obsidian's ![[note]] embed syntax with beautiful inline previews. When a note is embedded, show its content directly within the parent note with subtle visual distinction, similar to Notion's synced blocks.

card.title: Dark Mode Toggle
card.body: Implement a polished dark mode with carefully chosen colors that maintain readability and aesthetic appeal. Include smooth transitions between light and dark themes, matching Notion's implementation quality.

card.title: Sidebar Navigation Tree
card.body: Build a collapsible folder tree in the sidebar showing vault structure. Support drag-and-drop reorganization, quick search/filter, and visual indicators for notes with links or high connectivity in the graph.

card.title: Quick Search with Fuzzy Matching
card.body: Implement a keyboard-activated quick search (Cmd/Ctrl+K) with fuzzy matching across note titles, tags, and content. Show search results with context snippets and allow instant navigation, inspired by Notion's quick find.

card.title: Backlinks Panel
card.body: Display a dedicated panel showing all backlinks to the current note. Include context snippets showing where the link appears, making it easy to understand the relationship between connected notes.

card.title: Table of Contents Generation
card.body: Auto-generate a table of contents from markdown headings with smooth scrolling navigation. Can be displayed in a sidebar or inline at the top of long documents, similar to Notion's outline view.

card.title: Code Block Themes and Language Detection
card.body: Support syntax highlighting for code blocks with multiple theme options. Auto-detect programming languages and include copy-to-clipboard buttons. Make code presentation beautiful and functional.

card.title: Dataview Query Support
card.body: Support Obsidian's Dataview plugin syntax for creating dynamic lists and tables from note metadata. This allows users to create powerful dashboards and aggregated views of their knowledge base.

card.title: Breadcrumb Navigation
card.body: Show breadcrumb trails at the top of each note indicating its location in the folder hierarchy. Make breadcrumbs clickable for easy navigation to parent folders or sibling notes.

card.title: Image Gallery View
card.body: Create a special view mode that displays all images from a note or folder in a responsive gallery grid. Include lightbox functionality for fullscreen viewing with keyboard navigation.

card.title: Recent Notes and Favorites
card.body: Track recently viewed notes and allow users to star/favorite important notes. Display these in a quick-access section of the sidebar for easy retrieval of frequently referenced content.

card.title: Responsive Mobile Layout
card.body: Design a mobile-responsive layout that adapts gracefully to smaller screens. Collapsible sidebars, touch-friendly navigation, and optimized reading experience for tablets and phones.

card.title: Export Options
card.body: Provide export functionality for individual notes or entire vaults to formats like PDF, HTML, or Markdown. Include options to preserve styling and maintain internal links in exports.

payload.answer: Personal knowledge management (reading/browsing my own notes)

card.title: Design and implement SQLite schema
card.body:
Create database schema to store:
- Note content and metadata (title, created/modified dates, tags)
- Folder hierarchy and organization
- Wiki-links and backlinks relationships
- Search indexes for fast full-text search
- User preferences (favorites, recent notes)

Ensure schema supports efficient queries for graph view and supports concurrent read access for team viewing.

card.title: Build markdown parser with Obsidian syntax support
card.body:
Implement or integrate markdown parser that handles:
- Wiki-links [[like this]] and variants
- Embedded notes ![[note]]
- Tags (#tag and frontmatter tags)
- Callouts/admonitions
- Code blocks with syntax highlighting
- Tables, footnotes, and other extended markdown

Parser should extract link relationships for graph building.

card.title: Create Notion-inspired component library
card.body:
Build reusable UI components with Notion-like styling:
- Typography system (headings, body text, code)
- Color palette (light and dark themes)
- Layout primitives (sidebar, main content, panels)
- Interactive elements (buttons, inputs, dropdowns)
- Animation utilities for smooth transitions

Focus on clean, modern aesthetic with proper spacing and hierarchy.

card.title: Implement note rendering with wiki-link navigation
card.body:
Create the main note viewer component that:
- Renders parsed markdown with proper styling
- Makes wiki-links clickable for navigation
- Shows hover previews for linked notes
- Handles embedded note content
- Displays metadata (tags, backlinks count)
- Supports smooth navigation between notes

card.title: Build sidebar with folder tree and navigation
card.body:
Create collapsible sidebar showing:
- Folder hierarchy from vault structure
- Expand/collapse for nested folders
- Quick filter/search for sidebar content
- Visual indicators for note connectivity
- Recent notes section
- Favorites section

Must be responsive and collapse on mobile.

card.title: Implement quick search with fuzzy matching
card.body:
Build keyboard-activated search (Cmd/Ctrl+K) that:
- Searches across note titles, tags, and content
- Uses fuzzy matching algorithm
- Shows results with context snippets
- Supports keyboard navigation of results
- Allows instant navigation to selected note
- Updates results as user types

card.title: Create backlinks panel component
card.body:
Display backlinks for current note:
- List all notes that link to current note
- Show context snippet around each link
- Make backlinks clickable for navigation
- Update dynamically when navigating between notes
- Show count badge in note header

card.title: Build interactive graph visualization
card.body:
Implement graph view showing note connections:
- Use force-directed graph layout library (e.g., d3.js, vis.js)
- Nodes represent notes, edges represent links
- Interactive: zoom, pan, drag nodes
- Click node to navigate to that note
- Filter by tags or search term
- Visual styling to show note importance/connectivity

card.title: Implement dark mode with theme toggle
card.body:
Create dark theme variant:
- Design dark color palette maintaining readability
- Apply dark theme to all components
- Create smooth transition animation between themes
- Persist user preference in localStorage
- Add toggle button in header/settings
- Ensure code blocks and syntax highlighting work in both modes

card.title: Make responsive for mobile and tablet
card.body:
Optimize layout for smaller screens:
- Collapsible sidebar that overlays on mobile
- Touch-friendly tap targets and gestures
- Responsive typography scaling
- Optimize graph view for touch interaction
- Test on various device sizes
- Ensure search and navigation work well on mobile

card.title: Team Sharing and Permissions
card.body:
Since this will be used by teams, consider adding:
- Read-only access controls
- Ability to share specific vaults with team members
- User presence indicators (who's viewing what)

This would make it more suitable for team knowledge sharing.

card.title: Progressive Loading for Large Vaults
card.body: Implement lazy loading and virtualization for large note collections. Only render visible content in lists and sidebars, load note content on-demand, and use skeleton screens while loading. This ensures smooth performance even with thousands of notes.

card.title: Keyboard Shortcuts System
card.body: Create a comprehensive keyboard shortcut system for power users. Include shortcuts for navigation (j/k for up/down, g-g for top), search (Cmd/Ctrl+K), toggling views, and common actions. Display a shortcut cheat sheet accessible via '?' key.

card.title: Accessibility Features (WCAG Compliance)
card.body: Ensure the viewer is accessible to all users: proper ARIA labels, keyboard navigation for all features, screen reader support, sufficient color contrast ratios, focus indicators, and alt text for images. Target WCAG 2.1 AA compliance.

card.title: Link Preview on Hover
card.body: Show a popup preview of the linked note when hovering over wiki-links. Preview should include the note's first few lines or a summary, making it easy to understand the linked content without navigating away.

card.title: Custom Themes and Styling
card.body: Allow users to customize the viewer's appearance beyond light/dark mode. Support custom color schemes, font choices, spacing adjustments, and the ability to import/export theme configurations.

card.title: Reading Mode vs Edit Mode Toggle
card.body: Provide a distraction-free reading mode that hides UI chrome and focuses on content. Could include options like hiding the sidebar, centering content with optimal line length, and adjusting typography for reading comfort.

card.title: Smart Caching Strategy
card.body: Implement intelligent client-side caching for frequently accessed notes, graph data, and search indexes. Use service workers for offline support and faster subsequent loads. Cache invalidation should be smart about what changed.

card.title: Note Metadata Display
card.body: Show useful metadata for each note: creation date, last modified date, word count, reading time estimate, number of links (incoming/outgoing), and tags. Display this elegantly in the note header or a collapsible panel.

payload.body:
Implement or integrate markdown parser that handles:
- Wiki-links [[like this]] and variants
- Embedded notes ![[note]]
- Tags (#tag and frontmatter tags)
- Callouts/admonitions
- Code blocks with syntax highlighting
- Tables, footnotes, and other extended markdown

Parser should extract link relationships for graph building.

**Depends on:** SQLite schema (needs to understand storage structure)

Build reusable UI components with Notion-like styling:
- Typography system (headings, body text, code)
- Color palette (light and dark themes)
- Layout primitives (sidebar, main content, panels)
- Interactive elements (buttons, inputs, dropdowns)
- Animation utilities for smooth transitions

Focus on clean, modern aesthetic with proper spacing and hierarchy.

**Note:** This should be done early as other UI features depend on these components.

Create the main note viewer component that:
- Renders parsed markdown with proper styling
- Makes wiki-links clickable for navigation
- Shows hover previews for linked notes
- Handles embedded note content
- Displays metadata (tags, backlinks count)
- Supports smooth navigation between notes

**Depends on:** Markdown parser, Component library

Implement graph view showing note connections:
- Use force-directed graph layout library (e.g., d3.js, vis.js)
- Nodes represent notes, edges represent links
- Interactive: zoom, pan, drag nodes
- Click node to navigate to that note
- Filter by tags or search term
- Visual styling to show note importance/connectivity

**Depends on:** SQLite schema (needs link data from database)

Display backlinks for current note:
- List all notes that link to current note
- Show context snippet around each link
- Make backlinks clickable for navigation
- Update dynamically when navigating between notes
- Show count badge in note header

**Depends on:** Note rendering component (extends the viewer)

card.title: Docker Containerization & Easy Deployment
card.body: Package the application as a Docker container for easy deployment. Provide docker-compose setup with SQLite volume mounting, environment configuration, and optional reverse proxy setup. Include one-command deployment instructions for self-hosting.

card.title: Configuration File for Customization
card.body: Create a configuration file (YAML/JSON) that allows users to customize behavior without code changes: branding (logo, colors, app name), feature toggles (enable/disable graph view, search, etc.), default settings (theme, sidebar state), and vault-specific metadata.

card.title: Plugin/Extension System Architecture
card.body: Design an extensibility system for future plugins. Define extension points (custom markdown renderers, sidebar widgets, command palette actions) and a simple API. This allows community contributions without modifying core code. Similar to Obsidian's plugin ecosystem but for the viewer.

card.title: Analytics and Usage Insights Dashboard
card.body: For team deployments, provide an admin dashboard showing vault usage analytics: most viewed notes, popular search queries, active users, navigation patterns. Helps teams understand how their knowledge base is being used. Privacy-respecting with opt-in tracking.

card.title: Health Check & Diagnostics Tools
card.body: Build diagnostic tools for troubleshooting: vault integrity checker (broken links, orphaned files), performance profiler (identify slow queries), import validator (check SQLite schema), and system health endpoints for monitoring. Useful for both developers and users.

card.title: Progressive Web App (PWA) with Offline Support
card.body: Convert the web viewer into a Progressive Web App that works offline. Features: service worker for caching notes and assets, offline-first architecture using IndexedDB, installable as standalone app on desktop/mobile, background sync when connection returns. Enables users to browse their vault without internet connection - perfect for mobile use cases and unreliable connectivity.

card.title: Internationalization (i18n) and Localization
card.body: Add multi-language support for the UI to make the viewer accessible globally. Implement i18n framework (react-i18next or similar), extract all UI text into translation files, support RTL languages (Arabic, Hebrew), locale-aware date/time formatting. Start with English, then add community-contributed translations. Note content remains in original language, only UI is translated.

**Enhances:** Overall UX polish matching Notion's quality standards
